commander.name: Major-General Bernard Cyril Freyberg
commander.previous_service: Distinguished WWI veteran (Gallipoli, Somme, Passchendaele), commanded 2nd NZEF since formation

Ordnance QF 6-pounder.note: Early deployment, limited numbers arriving Q4 1941

supply_logistics.supply_status: Adequate for sustained offensive operations during Crusader. Primary constraints: fuel delivery from Tobruk perimeter (250km LOC) and ammunition resupply during mobile operations. Water discipline critical in desert environment.

weather_environment.terrain_type: coastal plain and rocky desert (Sidi Rezegh - Tobruk corridor)

subordinate_units.equipment_summary: 72× 25-pdr (4th, 5th, 6th Field Regiments), 52× AT guns (2-pdr & 6-pdr), 40× Bofors AA
Radio and wire communications, cipher section

tactical_doctrine.role: Elite combined-arms infantry division optimized for aggressive offensive operations and mobile desert warfare
special_capabilities: Exceptional unit cohesion and morale (volunteer force)
Proven leadership in Mediterranean theater (Greece, Crete, North Africa)
Strong artillery support with experienced gunnery
28th (Maori) Battalion elite shock troops for night attacks
Divisional Cavalry provides mobile reconnaissance screen
tactical_innovations: Maori Battalion renowned for night fighting, close combat, and morale effect on enemy
Combined infantry-artillery coordination refined in Operation Crusader
Adaptable combined-arms tactics for mobile desert warfare
Aggressive counterattack doctrine when opportunity presents
Effective infiltration tactics for strongpoint reduction
known_issues: Limited anti-tank capability - 2-pdr ineffective vs Panzer III/IV frontal armor
6-pdr AT guns arriving in limited numbers (12 guns Q4 1941)
No organic armor - dependent on attached British tank brigades
Weak anti-aircraft defense (Bofors effective only to 5,000 feet)
Extended supply lines vulnerable during rapid advance
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Fully acclimatized to desert conditions after 12 months in theater. Water discipline excellent, vehicle maintenance protocols for sand/dust environment, desert navigation proficiency, understanding of heat effects on weapons and equipment.

special_rules: 28th Maori Battalion: +2 close combat, +1 night operations, immune to first morale check
High cohesion: Re-roll failed morale checks once per battle
Aggressive doctrine: +1 to assault actions, may counterattack immediately
Veteran artillery: +1 artillery accuracy, reduced fire mission delays
Commonwealth logistics: Standard supply (no penalty Q4 1941)
historical_engagements: Greece Campaign (April 1941) - Defensive withdrawal under pressure
Battle of Crete (May 1941) - Evacuated after heroic defense
Operation Crusader (Nov-Dec 1941) - Tobruk breakout, captured thousands of Axis POWs
Ruweisat Ridge (July 1942) - El Alamein defensive battles

source: 1941-Q4 British organization JSON (95% confidence) - Primary organizational data
Nafziger Collection 941BKAD: British Forces, Operation Crusader, 18 November 1941 (92% confidence)
Nafziger Collection 941BKAB: British 8th Army, Tobruk, 27 November 1941 (92% confidence)

New Zealand Official War History (88% confidence) - Unit composition and operations
